textList.name: TEXT_LIGHTSPEED
textList.text: You've entered hyperspeed. Around you swirls distant stars and planets as they fly past at breakneck speed.
You've entered hyperspeed. The mild concern of smashing into a planet crosses your mind, but you figure some sort of security system is in place to prevent that. Hopefully.
You've entered hyperspeed. It's amazing to think long ago the idea of travelling between worlds in a matter of minutes to hours was nothing but a fantasy.
You've entered hyperspeed. You hope the light doesn't mind that you've showed them up.
You've entered hyperspeed. Old Earth scientists would be proud to know their research wasn't in vain.

You've entered hyperspeed. You can feel the gentle vibrations running down the ship. It would be relaxing, if it wasn't for the giant space rocks flying towards your ship at alarming speeds every few seconds.
You've entered hyperspeed. You make a quick trip to the engines to listen to the FTL drive hum away as it works.
You've entered hyperspeed. The journey to the next sector will hopefully be quick. The Rebel fleet might be fast, but they still can't follow you through hyperspeed.
You've entered hyperspeed. You catch a brief glimpse of what you think might be another ship in hyperspeed as well, but they quickly pass by.
You've entered hyperspeed. It must be an interesting life as a Civilian who never leaves their home planet. It's a tough choice sure, but the life of a traveller is one you'd never pass up.
You've entered hyperspeed. Your Multiverse drive is still charging. It can take months for it to be ready for the next reality jump, but your mission here isn't over yet anyways.
You've entered hyperspeed. Not to be confused with Multiverse travel, hyperspeed is merely the process of travelling from system to system, or sector to sector.

You've entered hyperspeed. While it can take mere minutes to travel between two beacons, it can take hours to travel between sectors. Fortunately this delay applies to all ships, including the Rebels.
You've entered hyperspeed. Your journey to the next sector should hopefully remain uneventful. Dead-space, as it's called, is the territory between sectors, and is known to be mostly empty.

event.name: ATLAS_EQUIPMENT
event.text: If you wish to do something during hyperspeed, now would be the time to do it.
How many buoys do you want to deploy?
You deploy the buoys.
You deploy the buoys.
You deploy the buoys.

choice.text: (Slip-Scanner) Run some scans. [Costs 3{, reveals next sector]

event.text: Scans complete!
Recycling complete!
Recycling complete!

choice.text: (Engine Overdrive) Activate the Capacitor. [Delays Fleet 3 jumps, will cause 6 damage to Engines and Hull. Removes Augment]

event.text: You feel as if your brain turns to jelly for a few moments as your ship jumps forward at incredible speeds. By the time you recover, you can hear the fire spreading in your burnt out engines.

event.name: ATLAS_MENU_LEARN
event.text: The Atlas is used to guide ships through hyperspeed, and ensure they do not jump into hazardous conditions. To do this, sectors must enter the co-ordinates of their start beacon into the Atlas so that ships may be directed to it. Your Atlas is currently pulling from the Federation Database, but may be updated with new coordinates you find on your travels.

LIST OF SECTOR CLASSIFICATIONS: Friendly - The faction that controls this sector is allied or on good terms with the Federation Neutral - The faction that controls this sector is neither an ally or an enemy Hostile - The faction that controls this sector is an enemy with the Federation Uncolonized - The sector is not under control by a faction, but has been charted Unmapped - The sector is unmapped nor under control by a faction
LIST OF SECTOR SUBTYPES: Nebula - The sector has a high concentration of nebulae Hazard - The sector has a large number of hazards, such as asteroid fields or stars

Locations of interest have been marked in certain sectors to denote a possible location that might be of benefit to visit. Usually, these do not come with coordinates attached, so you will have to find them yourself. Some sectors do not have locations of interest marked, but that does not mean they don't have any. It only means said location is currently unknown to you as of current. Some sectors have multiple locations of interest.

Throughout your travels, you might receive special coordinates to a special sector. You will only be able to visit these sectors once, but may do so during any period of hyperspeed travel before sector 8. Do note that doing so will override any Quests you would have found in the next sector.

choice.text: What is the Rebel threat level?

event.text: The Rebel threat can mean a few things. Sectors with a higher threat level have a larger concentration of Rebels, but it also represents the chance of encountering an MFK Ace at a fleet controlled beacon in that sector. Very Low - You will never encounter an MFK Ace here Low - MFK Aces have a 10% chance of appearing here Medium-Low - MFK Aces have a 20% chance of appearing here Medium - MFK Aces have a 30% chance of appearing here High - MFK Aces have a 50% chance of appearing here Very High - MFK Aces have a 75% chance of appearing here !CRITICALLY HIGH! - All fleet controlled beacons will have an MFK Ace Sectors with a rank of High or above will also always have an Ace at their exit beacon.

Some sectors have special kinds of fleets. These will be written in parenthesis next to the fleet threat level. (Auto) - Rather than Elite Rebels, you will encounter strong Auto-ships instead. There is no chance for an Ace to spawn. (Neutral) - Additional Federation backup will be supplied with a neutral ASB. Aces can spawn if the threat level permits.

event.name: ATLAS_MENU
event.text: While in hyperspeed, you have several options. You can proceed to your next sector or do something aboard the ship first.

choice.text: Proceed to the Free Mantis Sector.
Proceed to the Lost Sun Stronghold.
Proceed to the Central Shell Space.
Proceed to the Shell Science Center.
Proceed to the Ancient Recovery Site.

event.name: ATLAS_MENU_NOEQUIPMENT
event.text: You can now proceed to your next sector.

choice.text: Proceed to the Free Mantis Sector.
Proceed to the Lost Sun Stronghold.
Proceed to the Central Shell Space.
Proceed to the Shell Science Center.
Proceed to the Ancient Recovery Site.

event.name: ASTEROID_WARP
event.text:
Name: Mining Sector Type: Neutral (Hazard) Unique: False Dominant Faction: None Rebel Threat Level: Low
Sectors like these are littered with mineral-rich asteroid belts that draw in all sorts of prospectors. Though competition for coveted resources is high, the only major threat to you are the asteroids themselves.

event.name: CIVILIAN_WARP
event.text:
Name: Union Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: False Dominant Faction: Galactic Union Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
The Galactic Union is widely mocked for its name - don't be fooled. It's far from galactic, though its leaders would like to make you think it is. The Union is an alliance of many various previously independent corporate states. While primarily populated by humans, the Union has become the sanctuary for many alien refugees during recent times.

event.name: CIVILIAN_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Union Coreworlds Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: Galactic Union Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low Locations of Interest: Earth
The Union Coreworlds are also home to Earth, the homeworlds of man-kind. Heavily protected by the Militia, this is no place to play villain, unless you're willing to suffer the consequences. Despite this, in recent times a mysterious pirate faction known as the Brood have begun terrorizing Union settlements abroad. Keep a look out for these elusive pirates - there might be a reward for taking them down.

event.name: CIVILIAN_HACKED_WARP
event.text:
Name: Civilian Controlled Sector Type: ERROR Unique: ERROR Dominant Faction: ERROR Rebel Threat Level: ERROR
[Data Entries for this sector are corrupted. Recovery attempts failed. Proceeding with jump anyways.]

event.name: MILITIA_WARP
event.text:
Name: Militia Encampment Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: Civilian Militia Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low Locations of Interest: Militia Hangars
This sector is the central base of operations for the Militia. It holds their armories, hangars, barracks, and the like. It would be unwise to stir up trouble here.

event.name: ENGI_WARP
event.text:
Name: Engi Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: False Dominant Faction: Engi Harmony Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Harmony Link
The Engi are non-violent and generally friendly with the Federation. As long as you can avoid miscommunication errors, the native inhabitants will be little trouble. The same cannot be said, however, for other hostile invaders.

event.name: ENGI_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Engi Harmony Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: Engi Harmony Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Harmony Link
The Harmony is not to be confused with The Harmony, led by The Harmony. Records also show the remains of some massive super structures and a warrant out for a band of smugglers. Be on the lookout for anything out of the ordinary.

event.name: ZOLTAN_WARP
event.text:
Name: Zoltan Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: False Dominant Faction: Zoltan Ministry Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
Tensions between the Federation and Zoltan are high, but the Zoltan ultimately favor law and order over just about anything else. Don't push any buttons, and hopefully the Zoltan will let you pass without issue.

event.name: ZOLTAN_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Zoltan Capital Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: Zoltan Ministry Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low Locations of Interest: Unknown structure of high importance detected.
The Capital is the center of the Zoltan Ministry. Be cautious of not just Duskbringers, Pirates, and Rebels, but the Ministry's watchful eye as well. Your Federation authority might have some worth here, but it's nothing compared to the Ministry's.

event.name: ORCHID_WARP
event.text:
Name: Orchid Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: False Dominant Faction: Orchid Gathering Rebel Threat Level: Low
The Orchids are a peaceful race, lucky for you. Their specially grown kernel weaponry makes them powerful enemies, so be glad the plants will rarely attack you without you attacking first.

event.name: ORCHID_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Orchid Gardenworlds Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: Orchid Gathering Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Rt'lak Et
The Garden Worlds are the center of Orchid space, and is home to Rt'lak Et, the Grand Orchid Gardens and where the Orchid's ships and weapons are grown.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_WARP
event.text:
Name: Free Mantis Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: False Dominant Faction: The Free Mantis Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
The Free Mantis have captured this sector from the Zoltan. Though their addiction to pheromones may degrade their intelligence, the Free Mantis are exceedingly loyal to the Federation.

event.name: FREEMANTIS_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Free Mantis Hunting Grounds Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Free Mantis Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Zoltan and Mantis fleets detected.
This sector is an often visited location by the Free Mantis. An ex-Zoltan sector, Ministry citizens are the prime prey for the Free Mantis clans as revenge for the violent rejection they received during their immigration.

event.name: SEPARATIST_WARP
event.text:
Name: Separatist Controlled Sector Type: Neutral Unique: False Dominant Faction: Engi Separatists Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
The Separatists aren't huge friends to the Federation after they were refused support against the oppressive Harmony trying to stifle them. However, they usually like to keep to themselves, and hopefully won't be of too much issue to you.

event.name: CRYSTAL_WARP
event.text:
Name: Crystal Controlled Sector Type: Neutral Unique: False Dominant Faction: Crystalline Empire Rebel Threat Level: Medium
Crystal sectors are usually newly colonized and ever-expanding as their citizens struggle to claim territory for their own. A melting pot of opinions, you can never be certain what the Crystalline people will think of you...

event.name: CRYSTAL_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Crystalline New-Homelands Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Crystalline Empire Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Crystalline Capitol
These are, in fact, the second Homeworlds of the Crystals. After being forced out of their sector by greedy "pioneers", the Crystals have immigrated to this sector, and called it their own. Some of the staunchest xenophobic Crystals reside here, so be careful who you come in contact with...

event.name: OUTCAST_WARP
event.text:
Name: Outcast Controlled Sector Type: Neutral Unique: False Dominant Faction: Rock Outcasts Rebel Threat Level: Low
These sectors were once filled with industry and held strongly by the Theocracy. However, in recent times as the Elders' grasp slowly slips from their empire, these lands have become the prime locations for the political dissidents and refugees exiled from their old homes. Apparently, agents sent by the Crystalline Empire working for the "Sister-Species Liberation Group" have taken residence among the outcasts as well.

event.name: OUTCAST_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Theocracy Badlands Type: Neutral Unique: True Dominant Faction: Rock Outcasts Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Turban
On the very rim of Theocracy space, the so-called Badlands have become the densely populated center of the Outcast societies. This place is said to be rich in both trade and culture, but mentions of heavy Theocracy resistance as well as an influx of SSLG Agents sent by the Crystalline Empire could prove dangerous. At the center of it all is Turban, a rich city and one of the best established cities in all of Outcast space, and the prime target for any potential Theocracy attacks.

event.name: FEDERATION_WARP
event.text:
Name: Federation Controlled Sector Type: Friendly Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Federation Rebel Threat Level: High (Neutral Fleet) Locations of Interest: Node 17 Memorial
This is one of the last few Federation sectors remaining in this reality besides the capital itself. The Rebel fleet has directed their efforts heavily into overtaking this sector, so watch your step, and try to help as many of your allies as you can.

event.name: REBEL_WARP
event.text:
Name: Rebel Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: The Rebellion Rebel Threat Level: Very High
This old civilian sector has been captured by the Rebellion. Though you'll probably find a few Federation allies left, the bulk of encounters here will be with the Rebellion supporters.

event.name: REBEL_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Rebel Stronghold Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Rebellion Rebel Threat Level: !CRITICALLY HIGH! Locations of Interest: Rebel Hangars
This sector is in the very center of Rebel space, and is a center to the most prominent Rebel operations. If you had any hopes of seeing a friendly face from the Federation here, stiffle it immediately. Only a fool could dream something like that here.

event.name: PIRATE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Pirate Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: Pirates Rebel Threat Level: Medium
Pirate space is no safe spot for any ship. Fortunately, you should have little guilt picking off this sector's inhabitants, considering they'd be just as willing to do the same to you.

event.name: PIRATE_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: The Black Market Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Pirates Rebel Threat Level: Medium Locations of Interest: Sky-Drifter Casino, Smuggler Station
The Black Market is the base of operations for the Smuggler Clan. You'll find all sorts of people here, which can be both a wonderful and terrible thing...

event.name: MANTIS_WARP
event.text:
Name: Mantis Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: Mantis Hive Rebel Threat Level: Low
Mantis territory is heavily protected by the Hive. Divided into segments overwatched by Suzerains, this sector is no place for a Federation ship.

event.name: MANTIS_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Mantis Hive Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Mantis Hive Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: The Mantis Hive
This sector is home to Queen Leikonpliiinakra and her Mantis Bishops. The Mantis don't appreciate intruders, so be watchful of your step throughout this sector.

event.name: ROCK_WARP
event.text:
Name: Rock Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: Rock Theocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low
The Rock government holds an iron fist over its citizens, and the Rockmen are devoted to their faith. Though ignorant of the truth, and generally aggressive, it's not impossible to avoid a Rockman's wrath.

event.name: ROCK_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Rock Homeworlds Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Rock Theocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Vrachos IV
The Rockmen have fortified their homeworlds and hold complete control over this sector, or at least so they claim. Try not to get on the bad side of the Elders, and maybe you'll make it out alive.

event.name: LOSTSUN_WARP
event.text:
Name: Lost Sun Stronghold Type: Neutral Unique: True Dominant Faction: Lost Suns Rebel Threat Level: Low
This sector was once a holy site for the Rock Theocracy to worship the Crystals, but has since been converted into a defensive stronghold for the Lost Suns and their operations.

event.name: DUSKBRINGER_WARP
event.text:
Name: Duskbringer Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: Duskbringers Rebel Threat Level: High
The Duskbringers are much more aggressive than the Zoltan Ministry, and their sectors are a testament to it. Even worse, the Duskbringers and Rebels have been known to work in junction against the Federation, so you'll see few friendly faces here.

event.name: DUSKBRINGER_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Duskbringer Capitol Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Duskbringers Rebel Threat Level: Very High Locations of Interest: Duskbringer Capital
As a show of spite, the Duskbringers named this sector as their Capitol to declare their independence from the Ministry. Scans also show large concentrations of Rebels here, so watch your step.

event.name: COALITION_WARP
event.text:
Name: Coalition Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: The Coalition Rebel Threat Level: Medium
The Coalition are as much a threat to the Rebellion as the Federation, which could mean you won't find many Rebels here. However, that means little when the Coalition is always lurking about...

event.name: COALITION_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Coalition Stronghold Type: Hostile (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Coalition Rebel Threat Level: Low
This sector wasn't always a nebula, but scans show a massive concentration of synthetic nebulae here. Very strange...

event.name: AUTO_WARP
event.text:
Name: Automated Shipyards Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: The Rebellion Rebel Threat Level: High (Auto Fleet)
Though this sector belongs to the Rebellion, they have mostly left it to the Engineer Corps to maintain for the time being. Most functions here are completely automated, but even without human Rebels to deal with, that makes their Auto-ships no less a threat.

event.name: AUTO_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Central Automated Shipyards Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: The Rebellion Rebel Threat Level: Very High (Auto Fleet) Locations of Interest: Central Power Core
This sector is the center of Auto-ship production. With a much larger staff of Engineers protecting it, don't be surprised to run into a few well armed Engineer vessels along with the usual Auto-ships of this sector.

event.name: ESTATE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Wentworth Innovations HQ Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Wentworth Innovations (Union subsidiary) Rebel Threat Level: !CRITICALLY HIGH! (Auto Fleet) Locations of Interest: Wentworth Innovations HQ, Mercury Shipyards
One of the largest megacorps within the Union, Wentworth Innovations is the family corporation of none other than Vance Wentworth himself, Admiral and founder of the Rebellion. However, due to the Admiral's absence, the vice president Cayden Stimly has taken temporary charge. Under the direction of Stimly, the company has become exceptionally aggressive towards competition and holds the Union leadership under a spell of bribery. Tread with caution.

event.name: ABANDONED_WARP
event.text:
Name: Abandoned Sector Type: Uncolonized Unique: False Dominant Faction: None Rebel Threat Level: Medium
This was once a civilian sector, but after heavy conflict it was abandoned. Now, it serves as a melting pot of scavengers from all over the galaxy hoping to make a profit off of not just the ruins, but ships like yours as well.

event.name: LANIUS_WARP
event.text:
Name: Lanius Swarmlands Type: Neutral Unique: True Dominant Faction: Lanius Swarm Rebel Threat Level: Low
During the extensive Lanius hibernation, this sector was ravaged by pirates and Ghosts. Now the swarm has awakened once again, and they aren't pleased. However, maybe with a bit of scrap, you can please the Lanius enough to let you through unharmed.

event.name: NEBULA_WARP
event.text:
Name: Nebula Sector Type: Unmapped (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: None Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
This sector remains uncolonized and largely unmapped. There's no saying what you might find here, and the Atlas provides little more info.

event.name: SLUG_WARP
event.text:
Name: Slug Controlled Sector Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Slug Kleptocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low
The Slugs were exiled from the Federation long ago, but they're little more than indifferent about it. A species of mostly criminals, just about everyone here will want to scam you. Always be on alert as you traverse this nebula, the Slugs are watching...

event.name: SLUG_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Slug Homeworlds Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Slug Kleptocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Expensive Slug pleasure barge seen traversing this sector.
The Slug Homeworlds are the hub of scum and thieves living the high-life on their riches. Be careful who you trust, especially when they're a Slug.

event.name: CLAN_WARP
event.text:
Name: Guild Territory Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Exotic Hunters Guild Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: High value bounty being solicited for an entity known as the 'Salt Man'
This sector is the home, hunting grounds, and gathering spot of the EHG. Though the EHG is part of the Kleptocracy still, they hold a large amount of territory. Unfortunately, now that you're here, you'll likely end up on their list of prized hunts until you can escape.

event.name: SHELL_WARP
event.text:
Name: Shell Controlled Sector Type: Friendly (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Shell Geniocracy Rebel Threat Level: Medium
The Shells are usually friendly, but their cultural practices often lead to misunderstandings with races when they attempt to run harmless experiments on abducted crew. Try to be tolerant, and the Shells won't be much of an issue to you.

event.name: SHELL_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Central Shell Space Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Shell Geniocracy Rebel Threat Level: Medium Locations of Interest: Long-range Federation distress call registered
Though the Shells evolved on the same planet as the Slugs, they were forced out by their much more aggressive cousin species. The Shells have settled here, and have set up heavy defenses to protect their territory.

event.name: MORPH_WARP
event.text:
Name: Shell Science Center Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Shell Geniocracy Rebel Threat Level: High Locations of Interest: Genetic Enhancement and Research Laboratories
Oddly enough, a large amount of data provided by the sector seems to have been wiped by the creators of the entry point. There's some gibberish in here as well, and a large warning printed advising travelers to stay away. It's too late to go back now, so hopefully we don't find ourselves in a crisis situation right off the start!

event.name: LEECH_WARP
event.text:
Name: Leech Controlled Sector Type: Neutral (Hazard) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Eargen Republic Rebel Threat Level: Low
Don't expect your largest threat here to be the Leeches themselves. Their kind have mostly stayed neutral towards the Federation - the risk lies between the Inquisition and Coalition forces allied with the Republic. Be careful with who you confide in here, and try not to take too much advantage of the downtrodden citizens here.

event.name: LEECH_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Eargen Capital Type: Neutral (Hazard) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Eargen Republic Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: An Inquisition Commander known as Gora has been seen entering this sector. The private mansion of President Tyrdeo can be found here.
This sector not only houses the center of the Eargen Republic, but also a lesser-known civil war that also involves the Inquisition, Coalition, and the Vampweeds. None of these factions are friends with the Federation, but hopefully they'll be distracted enough with each other to not notice you.

event.name: GHOST_WARP
event.text:
Name: Vagabond Nebulae Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Vagabond Clans Rebel Threat Level: Medium
The Vagabonds are nomadic Ghosts who split off from the Dynasty long ago. While they're mostly indifferent to you, the Dynasty is well known for being incredibly aggressive and cryptic. Be hopeful you don't see much of them here...

event.name: GHOST_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Spectral Wastelands Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Vagabond Clans Rebel Threat Level: Medium Locations of Interest: High value bounty being solicited for Rebel vessel
This sector once belonged to the Dynasty, but some unknown force came through here, wiping out most of their colonies. All that remains are scavengers and a few Dynasty vessels sent to reclaim what little they can.

event.name: DYNASTY_WARP
event.text:
Name: Spectral Nebulae Type: Hostile (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Spectral Dynasty Rebel Threat Level: High (Auto Fleet)
Don't expect to see many manned Rebel ships here - the Rebellion's fight against the Ghosts and their Dynasty is almost entirely automated. Unfortunately, the Dynasty seems to hold this invasion against not just the Rebellion, but the Federation as well.

event.name: DYNASTY_UNIQUE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Spectral Capital Type: Hostile (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Spectral Dynasty Rebel Threat Level: Very High (Auto Fleet) Locations of Interest: Dynasty Capitol, Ancient Ruins
Reports show the Rebellion deployed a massive carrier vessel to this sector not too long ago. A ship of such size must have been carrying a vessel of equally immense threat, but no accurate data is provided. Let's hope the resident Ghosts have already taken care of it and you can move on in peace.

event.name: MONK_WARP
event.text:
Name: Monk Refuge Type: Friendly (Nebula) Unique: True Dominant Faction: Zoltan Ministry Rebel Threat Level: Low
This sector is a hiding place for the most devoted of the Zoltan Monks; their religion prevents them from participating in violent acts.

event.name: SALE_SLUG_WARP
event.text:
Name: Slug Controlled Sector Type: Neutral (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: Slug Kleptocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low
The Slugs were exiled from the Federation long ago, but they're little more than indifferent about it. A species of mostly criminals, just about everyone here will want to scam you. Always be on alert as you traverse this nebula, the Slugs are watching... At the bottom of your Atlas, you notice a small "H" logo... a sponsorship? It reads "Come visit the local Hektar Industries Market Places!" Huh...

Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by an unusual advertisement; "Greetingsss valued Hektar customer! Thiss isss Billy Hektar, CEO of the Hektar Corporation speaking to you. Asss part of our new cussstomer loyalty program, I am proud to introduce our new 'Unwavering Wage Utility Points!' Each time you vissit a Hektar(tm) brand ssstore, our friendly cussstomer support vesssselss will add an extra U.W.U. point to your account! Collect enough, and you'll be able to enter our reward program! Happy ssshopping!" The advertisement concludes, and a cheerful jingle plays over your computer, followed by the motto "Satisfaction guaranteed, because you aren't getting your money back!"
Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by the same advertisement as before. Looks like this is yet another Hektar market sector.

event.name: SALE_PIRATE_WARP
event.text:
Name: Pirate Controlled Sector Type: Hostile Unique: False Dominant Faction: Pirates Rebel Threat Level: Medium
Pirate space is no safe spot for any ship. Fortunately, you should have little guilt picking off this sector's inhabitants, considering they'd be just as willing to do the same to you. At the bottom of your Atlas, you notice a small "H" logo... a sponsorship? It reads "Come visit the local Hektar Industries Market Places!" Huh...

Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by an unusual advertisement; "Greetingsss valued Hektar customer! Thiss isss Billy Hektar, CEO of the Hektar Corporation speaking to you. Asss part of our new cussstomer loyalty program, I am proud to introduce our new 'Unwavering Wage Utility Points!' Each time you vissit a Hektar(tm) brand ssstore, our friendly cussstomer support vesssselss will add an extra U.W.U. point to your account! Collect enough, and you'll be able to enter our reward program! Happy ssshopping!" The advertisement concludes, and a cheerful jingle plays over your computer, followed by the motto "Satisfaction guaranteed, because you aren't getting your money back!"
Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by the same advertisement as before. Looks like this is yet another Hektar market sector.

event.name: SALE_NEBULA_WARP
event.text:
Name: Nebula Sector Type: Unmapped (Nebula) Unique: False Dominant Faction: None Rebel Threat Level: Medium-Low
This sector remains uncolonized and largely unmapped. There's no saying what you might find here, and the Atlas provides little more info. At the bottom of your Atlas, you notice a small "H" logo... a sponsorship? It reads "Come visit the local Hektar Industries Market Places!" Huh...

Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by an unusual advertisement; "Greetingsss valued Hektar customer! Thiss isss Billy Hektar, CEO of the Hektar Corporation speaking to you. Asss part of our new cussstomer loyalty program, I am proud to introduce our new 'Unwavering Wage Utility Points!' Each time you vissit a Hektar(tm) brand ssstore, our friendly cussstomer support vesssselss will add an extra U.W.U. point to your account! Collect enough, and you'll be able to enter our reward program! Happy ssshopping!" The advertisement concludes, and a cheerful jingle plays over your computer, followed by the motto "Satisfaction guaranteed, because you aren't getting your money back!"
Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by the same advertisement as before. Looks like this is yet another Hektar market sector.

event.name: SALE_ABANDONED_WARP
event.text:
Name: Abandoned Sector Type: Uncolonized Unique: False Dominant Faction: None Rebel Threat Level: Medium
This was once a civilian sector, but after heavy conflict it was abandoned. Now, it serves as a melting pot of scavengers from all over the galaxy hoping to make a profit off of not just the ruins, but ships like yours as well. At the bottom of your Atlas, you notice a small "H" logo... a sponsorship? It reads "Come visit the local Hektar Industries Market Places!" Huh...

Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by an unusual advertisement; "Greetingsss valued Hektar customer! Thiss isss Billy Hektar, CEO of the Hektar Corporation speaking to you. Asss part of our new cussstomer loyalty program, I am proud to introduce our new 'Unwavering Wage Utility Points!' Each time you vissit a Hektar(tm) brand ssstore, our friendly cussstomer support vesssselss will add an extra U.W.U. point to your account! Collect enough, and you'll be able to enter our reward program! Happy ssshopping!" The advertisement concludes, and a cheerful jingle plays over your computer, followed by the motto "Satisfaction guaranteed, because you aren't getting your money back!"
Before you can finish exiting Hyperspeed, you're greeted by the same advertisement as before. Looks like this is yet another Hektar market sector.

event.name: AUGMENTED_WARP
event.text:
Name: Ancient Recovery Site Type: Neutral Dominant Faction: Augmented Lanius Rebel Threat Level: Low
There is little information on this sector. It seems the ruins of some ancient race have been uncovered here, and it was promptly swarmed by a band of Lanius known as the Augmented.

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

event.name: ANCIENT_WARP
event.text:
Name: ??? Type: ??? Dominant Faction: ??? Rebel Threat Level: ???
There is no data about the next sector in your Atlas.

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

Name: ??? Type: ??? Dominant Faction: ??? Rebel Threat Level: ???
There is no data about the next sector in your Atlas.

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

event.name: ORIGINS_WARP
event.text:
Name: Crystalline Origins Type: ??? Dominant Faction: ??? Rebel Threat Level: ???
There is next to no information about this sector in your Atlas. What little data there is suggests this was the old homeworlds of the Crystalline Empire before they were forced about by greedy "pioneers."

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

event.name: ORIGINS_RUWEN_WARP
event.text:
Name: Crystalline Origins Type: ??? Dominant Faction: ??? Rebel Threat Level: ???
There is next to no information about this sector in your Atlas. What little data there is suggests this was the old homeworlds of the Crystalline Empire before they were forced about by greedy "pioneers."

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

event.name: NEXUS_WARP
event.text:
Name: ??? Type: ??? Dominant Faction: ??? Rebel Threat Level: ???
Wherever you're going, it sure isn't Kansas anymore. You aren't even sure if you're in the same reality. Wherever you were just pulled into is halfway across the entire Multiverse!

choice.text: You cannot reroute during this jump.

event.name: REROUTE_MENU
event.text: Where do you want to reroute to? [WARNING: Rerouting means you will miss any quests that would have spawned in the next sector.]

event.name: REROUTE_MENU_LASTSTAND
event.text: Where do you want to reroute to? [WARNING: Rerouting means you will miss any quests that would have spawned in the next sector.]

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_SPIDER
event.text:
You are about to reroute. Below is the Atlas entry for this sector. Name: Infested Sector Type: Hostile Dominant Faction: Militia, The Brood (pirates) Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: Spider Hive
A civilian sector under duress, these coords were given to you by the Militia, in hopes you could assist with their spider infestation issues.
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_JERRY
event.text:
You are about to reroute. Below is the Atlas entry for this sector. Name: Jerome Protectorate Type: Hostile Dominant Faction: The Rebellion Rebel Threat Level: Very High
A secondary Rebel stronghold kept under rule by Jerome Wentworth, Admiral Vance of the Rebel fleet's nephew. A high priority target undoubtedly, and taking him out could weaken the Rebel fleet.
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_NIGHTS
event.text:
You are about to reroute. Below is the Atlas entry for this sector. Name: Royal Slug Nebulae Type: Hostile Dominant Faction: Slug Kleptocracy Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: The Slug Palace
This sector is home to the Slug Royal family... which currently just consists of Captain Nights. Slocknog gave you these coordinates to come "watch the spectacle", which likely can't mean anything good.
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_HEKTAR
event.text:
You are about to reroute. Below is the Atlas entry for this sector. Name: Hektar Mega-Market(tm) Type: Neutral Dominant Faction: Hektar Industries Rebel Threat Level: Very Low Locations of Interest: Hektar Industries HQ
The entries for this sector are bloated with product placements and corporate jargon. What concerns you more however is the massive number of distress beacons located within this sector. This should be interesting...
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_ESTATE
event.text:
You are about to reroute. Below is the Atlas entry for this sector. Name: Wentworth Innovations HQ Type: Hostile Dominant Faction: Wentworth Innovations (Union subsidiary) Rebel Threat Level: !CRITICALLY HIGH! (Auto Fleet) Locations of Interest: W.I. HQ, Mercury Shipyards
One of the largest megacorps within the Union, Wentworth Innovations is the family corporation of none other than Admiral Vance himself. However, due to his absence, VP Cayden Stimly has taken temporary charge. Under his direction, the company has become exceptionally aggressive towards competition, and holds the Union leadership under a spell of bribery. Tread with caution.
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.

event.name: LIGHTSPEED_SECTOR_WARP_HIVE
event.text:
Name: Mantis Hive Type: Hostile Unique: True Dominant Faction: Mantis Hive Rebel Threat Level: Low Locations of Interest: The Mantis Hive
This sector is home to Queen Leikonpliiinakra and her Mantis Bishops. The Mantis don't appreciate intruders, so be watchful of your step throughout this sector.
You prepare to jump to the new co-ordinates, and change your flight path accordingly.
